page.title: 16 Barham.Two Great Houses.
page.content: Denne Hill is an art gallery.The sculptures are mainly about people.William the Conqueror gave Denne Hill to the Denne family.The present house was built in the 1870's.When Nicholas Treadwell bought Denne Hill in 1977 it was in a very bad state of repair and threatened by demolition.Now people come from all over the world to see the exhibits.The sculptures are made out of fibreglass and leather and some are even made out of toy guns. Broome Park was built in April 1635. It is a large house with many sports facilities like golf,tennis and swimming.There are also Time Share villas where people can stay for their holidays each year.Lord Kitchener bought the house in 1911.During World War II a Canadian tank regiment was stationed there.
